intro: Homalobus strigosus, commonly known as the hairy homalobus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Homalobus strigosus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
